content:
Modern AI Agents are coupled with runtime sandbox for filesystem access and runtime isolation. Sometimes referred to as Computer-Use Agents (CUA), they autonomously code, use terminal, take notes, and access Internet like human does. In this post, let’s dive into agent design principles beneath popular scaffolds like Claude Code, Gemini (Google AI Studio) and ChatGPT Agent, and unveil how agents benefit from better context management, broader action space and autonomous workflows.
Why Sandbox? Claude Code – More than Just Code MiniMax Agent – The “Deepest” Other CUA ChatGPT Atlas/Agent Mode Google AI Studio Agentic RL – Rollout Env OpenEnv OpenHands Feel free to connect with me on GitHub, LinkedIn, or X.

content:
This is a fairly procrastinated start to my personal blog. Starting a blog isn‚Äôt as easy as it seems‚ÄîI don‚Äôt want to waste people‚Äôs time with casual anecdotes. Meanwhile, an overly formal academic write-up would likely be overkill and scare people away.
There are many people who truly enjoy machine learning and find joy in sharing knowledge. I‚Äôve been a long-time follower of AI/tech blogs from Andrej Karpathy, Lilian Weng, Yao Fu, and others. I usually prefer blogs over papers because blogs feel more honest and less AI-polished (or written to attract citations). Yet almost everyone I followed stopped posting in early 2025. I understand the shifts and hype in SF lately that keep everyone busy building and/or financially free. Still, I‚Äôd be sad if this vibe disappears‚Äîit‚Äôs been truly helpful to me over the past few years, along with many others.
I‚Äôve been more of a builder than a writer, hesitant to publish conclusions without solid ground. But lately I‚Äôve found it really fruitful to do deep dives into the state of things and the literature before engineering. A blog of ‚Äústudy notes‚Äù not only helps me organize thoughts, but also carries on that missing vibe of sharing knowledge in a blunt and unpretentious way. And so I finally made up my mind to start writing‚Äîand I truly hope you enjoy it. Stay tuned and keep the spark going!
What to Expect I’ll be writing about:
Tech Hacks: Most of the time, truth in tech doesn’t reside in reports or posts but hidden in code. I enjoy digging these gems out to see the real flow. Different AI Research: I continuously keep track of frontier AI research and especially favor the non-incremental ones, like new architectures to model intelligence. Stories and Gossip: The true frontier trends and news usually come from stories and gossip shared through friends, meetups, or conferences. Feel free to connect with me on LinkedIn or X, or email to billxbf@gmail.com
